CRACK Headphones

Crack headphone is a uniquely and stylishly designed headphone that adds sophistication, retro-modern and style to your everyday life. With built in speakers, the compact design can be used anywhere.

Overview

My Role

  • Product Designer
  • UX Researcher
  • UI/UX Designer

Category

  • Sound
  • Luxury
  • Travel
  • Creative Design

Mission

  • Design a unique and luxurious headphone.
  • Think of innovative features that will beat the headphone competitions.

Tools

  • Autocad Maya
  • Cinema 4D
  • Adobe photoshop

Team

  • kamil Oseni
  • Ria Kunti
  • Crixx Ayo
  • Kasali Abimbola

Timeline

  • july 2015 - present

About

No matter how interesting an activity may be, no one enjoys stress. And to avoid stress would be like trying to do a vigorous exercise without sweating, I mean it’s impossible; but that’s exactly what we tried to do with the headphones. Everything about the design is focused on delivering incredible sound and comfort with enhanced simplicity.

As part of an exhausting research development in the headphone market, we discovered some interesting finds as regards to peoples’ needs. With this, we were able to determine a common volume and this was our starting point for developing a brand to meet a broad range of needs, Crack!

Understanding the User

Summary

During the course of the project, I conducted both Primary and Secondary research which involved using Qualitative and Quantitative data. Primary research I conducted were mainly through direct interviews and survey which gave me an idea of user pain points and helped in determining what features will be in the headphones but this didn’t give me enough data as it was geographically limited to my surrounding, so most data used for this project were gotten through secondary research.

Pain Points

Music Sharing

I need to be able to share a song I’m listening to with someone else easily.

Easy Pause

I need an easy way to pause and play music while using my headphones.

Earpad Replacement

It’s too much work replacing the ear pads of my headphone when they need to be replaced.

Battery Level

My headphone sometimes die at odd times or when i’m enjoying a song.

Persona: Stephanie

“I know it’s easy to just Shazam a song, but I want something easier”

Problem Statement

Stephanie is a music lover who needs to be able to easily share-play songs with others and to easily pause and play songs because she doesn’t like the hassle that comes with searching for songs and also wants an easier way to pause and play music while she paints.

Goals

  • Spend more time enjoying a song with someone else than in looking up that song.
  • Pause and play songs with ease.

Frustrations

  • I can’t sync-listen to a song with my daughter at the park without using 3rd-party apps or wired extensions.

Stephanie is a single mother of one with a busy and demanding schedule. She visits the park with her daughter two times every month, where they get to spend time together painting and listening to songs as they are art and music lovers. Stephanie and her daughter listen to songs while painting, and would love if there is an easier way for them to listen to the same songs at the same time and to pause and play songs without smearing their phones with paint.

Persona: John

“A bad event is a slap in the face of my career”

Problem Statement

John is a music DJ who needs to easily know the battery level of his wireless headphone because he gets disconnected often times during an event due to a low battery level. He also would like a headphone with easy-to-replace ear pads.

Goals

  • Spend more time enjoying a song with someone else than in looking up that song.
  • Pause and play songs with ease.

Frustrations

  • I can’t sync-listen to a song with my daughter at the park without using 3rd-party apps or wired extensions.

Stephanie is a single mother of one with a busy and demanding schedule. She visits the park with her daughter two times every month, where they get to spend time together painting and listening to songs as they are art and music lovers. Stephanie and her daughter listen to songs while painting, and would love if there is an easier way for them to listen to the same songs at the same time and to pause and play songs without smearing their phones with paint.

A 2017 United States Statista survey asked people (aged 18 or older) how and for what purposes they use headphones. The results showed people use headphones for more than just listening to music, proving how ingrained they’ve become in our modern way of life.

Build and Design Process

Sketches

In order to conceptualize the appearance and tactile qualities of the headphones, I have established the following guiding objectives:

  • Utilizing data obtained through user research and competitive analysis, create a sketch of the headphones with consideration for the following categories: shape, comfort, accessibility, material, dimensions, and sizing.
  • Naming the headphones and designing an appropriate logo

Digital Wireframes

3D Design

Embossed “CRACK” text with a cracked feel and also a solar panel for charging.

Buttons to help with Quick Pause/Play, Next, and Previous commands.

Tiangular shaped design and easy to replace earpads

LED “CRACK” battery indicator. Each letter represents a 20% charge level.

Link Up buttons to sync-play music with other close ranged crack headphones.

Logo

Coming up with a name for the headphones was a humorous and imaginative process. After a long day of trying to come up with a name, I decided to take a break and as I looked around the room, my eyes landed on a crack in the wall. That's when it hit me - "Crack" would be the perfect name for the headphones. The design of the word logo was inspired by that moment, and the brandmark logo actually came to me in a dream later that same night.

A flat and simple logo was also created for a mobile-first design experience so it can present well across different mediums.

Competitive Audit

Goals

During the competitive audit and market research, the major goals were to figure out who our key competitors are, what they were doing right and what their weaknesses are in order to help improve our product. The following are the guiding questions used to determine the goals.

  • Who are our key competitors?
  • What is their best headphone in the market, how much is it and what quality does it possess?
  • What are the competitors strengths?
  • What are the competitors weaknesses?
Key Competitors Top Product Price(AMAZON) Product Strengths Product Weaknesses
Bose Bose QuietComfort 45/QC45 $329.00
  • Very comfortable and great for commute and travel.
  • Good build quality.
  • Excellent noise isolation performance.
  • Bulky and can fall off your head with more intense movement.
Sony Sony WH-1000XM4 $348.00
  • Comfortable fit.
  • Incredible ANC performance.
  • Over 37-hour continuous battery life
  • Bulky design

** Strengths and weaknesses are based on comparison with CRACK headphones under the category - Fashion Headphone

Bose
Strengths: Strong brand reputation and awareness, high-quality sound, innovative products, a wide range of products.
Weaknesses: Higher pricing, limited distribution channels.
Opportunities: Expansion into new markets, development of new product lines, leveraging new technologies
Threats: Intense competition, rapidly changing consumer preferences, economic downturns

Sennheiser
Strengths: Strong brand reputation, high-quality sound, innovative products, a wide range of products.
Weaknesses: Higher pricing, limited distribution channels..
Opportunities: Expansion into new markets, development of new product lines, leveraging new technologies.
Threats: Intense competition, rapidly changing consumer preferences, economic downturns.


Beats
Strengths: Strong brand recognition and reputation, stylish design, aggressive marketing, wide distribution channels
Weaknesses: Limited product range, higher pricing.
Opportunities: Expansion into new markets, development of new product lines, partnerships and collaborations.
Threats: Intense competition, rapidly changing consumer preferences, economic downturns.


Sony

Strengths: Strong brand recognition and reputation, wide range of products, good sound quality.

Weaknesses: Limited distribution channels, lack of brand awareness.

Opportunities: Expansion into new markets, development of new product lines, leveraging new technologies Threats: Intense competition, rapidly changing consumer preferences, economic downturns.

Features

The Crack headphones will provide a comfortable listening experience from one person to the next with these unique features:

  • LINK-UP: The headphones come with an incredible link-up feature that allow Crack headphones connect wirelessly allowing two or more users listen to the same music from one source with just a push of a button either on the headphone or in the Crack app.
  • SMART PAUSE: Another interesting feature is the pause & play feature which allows an automatic pause once the headphone is taken off and an automatic play when it is put back on.
  • REPLACEABLE EAR PADS: The ear pads come in different colors, and also limited ear-foams for limited editions; e.g. the Glow in the Dark edition and the Gold edition. Compared with a lot of other headphones, these ear-foams can manually and easily be replaced by the user.
  • LED BATTERY GAUGE: The LED display light indicates charge level of headphone. There are five charge levels represented by the letters C R A C K which glows.
  • DETACHABLE CABLES: 69.2% of people who took a twitter survey said they could go back to using an audio jack (AUX) after using wireless bluetooth headphones.While most respondents agree that wired traditional headphones generally have better audio quality, the convenience of wirelessly connected headphones is hard to pass. So why not have a design that incorporates both worlds for the best user experience? The headphone can both be used wired or wirelessly, the cables come in different colors and design like the ear pads which can also be replaced and is also available for the “Glow in the Dark”, “Party” and “Gold” editions.

Going Forward

Next Steps

  • An extended VR version is being designed, it already has passed the research stage.
  • Some of the goals for the VR version are:
    • Sports: We want to give users a different experience by live streaming sports in Virtual Reality.
    • Dreams: We will also make the interpretation of dreams easier and more fun by creating a virtual community of VR world designers that design people’s dreams and with the use of AI, designing these worlds will be easier.
  • CRACK AI will be introduced with a fully functional Personal Assistant like Alexa, Siri, Cortana etc.
  • The AI will be integrated into the extended VR/AR version, and should be a game changer in education and the interpretation of dreams.
  • An App (CRACK) will be designed to accomodate controls for the headphone, and the VR, and will contan many more features like a social media for crack users where you can see what other crack users are listening to and see crack headphones near you.

With enough funding and a more refined research, the headphones and VR will come to life.
Music is so important that they say it is the food for the soul. We wanted to make a headphone that makes a user feel connected to every sound. Hence, the emergence of CRACK.
